Electroreception.notes: As members of the Batoidea superorder, softnose skates likely possess electroreception to detect prey and navigate. This is inferred, as the context does not specify sensory abilities but indicates relatedness to other rays.

Mechanoreception.notes: Skates possess mechanoreceptors, including the lateral line system, for detecting water movement and pressure changes.

Vision.notes: Skates possess eyes, suggesting visual capabilities. However, the extent of their vision is not detailed in the given text.

Chemoreception.notes: Skates possess chemoreceptors for detecting chemical cues in the water, aiding in prey detection and navigation.
